the act of confiscating a possession from someone (= taking it away as a punishment) or an example of this: There was a record number of confiscations by customs officers last year. Penalties range from 3 months to 5 years in prison and the confiscation of property. See
confiscate
More examplesFewer examples The court ordered the confiscation of all his assets. They will consider a confiscation order for drink drivers who are a menace to society.There have been reports of confiscation of passports and large monetary demands for their return.
